Objects in Processing

26 September 2010

My first experiment with objects and object oriented programming in Processing.


This simple sketch creates a new object at runtime, then whenever the mouse it clicked. Each object creates a square on the screen wherever the mouse is. When you press any key all the objects are “killed” and the squares disappear. I had forgotten how powerful, and annoying, OOP is.

Download the sketch or the jar.

Paul May is a researcher and designer from Dublin, living and working in New York. Find out more about Paul's work or get in touch.
